class_notes:
FULL TITLE:  Scientific Communication for Scientists.
This course is designed for SENIORS who are currently conducting laboratory research and are likely applying for graduate school in STEM in the next year or two. We will begin with written science communication, crafting a fellowship application for the National Science Foundation. We will conclude with oral and visual communication, including giving engaging slide-based talks, compelling data presentation, accessibility considerations, and communication for a non-scientific audience. The course will involve multiple rounds of feedback and iteration on deliverables (e.g. fellowship, presentation), and may involve a considerable amount of time outside of class, especially during the first half of the semester. Enrollment is by instructor permission only. Contact Dr. Leila Rieder at leila.rieder@emory.edu for permission.
